intro: Tovomitopsis croatii, commonly known as the Croatian tovomitopsis, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of Croatia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in shaded, woodland habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Tovomitopsis croatii is considered a vulnerable species.
